sample_data.2024 Status: No traditional zoning; uses subdivision ordinances and deed restrictions
sample_data.2025 Updates: Continues with no zoning; relies on subdivision ordinances only
sample_data.Impact on Development: Flexibility but reliance on deed restrictions; no comprehensive land use planning

sample_data.2024 Status: 2021 International Codes adopted January 1, 2024 (IBC, IRC, IFC, etc.)
sample_data.2025 Updates: Same 2021 codes remain in effect with Houston amendments
sample_data.Impact on Development: Enhanced energy efficiency (8.9% savings), improved safety standards

sample_data.2024 Status: Expected release early 2025; maps not updated since 2007
sample_data.2025 Updates: Delayed until 2026; 100-year floodplain expected to expand significantly
sample_data.Impact on Development: Continued uncertainty for flood insurance requirements and development planning

sample_data.2024 Status: Not enacted; cities maintained full zoning authority
sample_data.2025 Updates: Commercial-to-residential conversion by right; limits municipal restrictions
sample_data.Impact on Development: Streamlined multifamily development in commercial zones; reduced municipal control

sample_data.2025 Updates: 30-day pilot program launched July 7 for single-family permits
sample_data.Impact on Development: Faster single-family home permitting; improved developer confidence
